description: Alteration of roof from hip to gable end; rear roof extension incorporating a Juliet balcony and installation of two roof lights to front roof slope
decision_conditions: The development to which this permission relates shall be begun not later than the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

Reason: To comply with Section 91 of the Town & Country Planning Act 1990. | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing / document title number(s):  2214 L(--) 101* (Proposed roof plan site plan), 2214 L(--) 102* (Proposed ground floor plan), 2214 L(--) 103* (Proposed first floor plan), 2214 L(--) 104* (Proposed loft floor plan), 2214 L(--) 105* (Proposed front and rear elevations), 2214 L(--) 106* (Proposed side elevation), 2214 L(--) 107* (Proposed Section AA), 2214 L(--) 000* (Existing site location map), 2214 L(--) 001* (Existing roof plan), 2214 L(--) 002* (Existing ground floor plan), 2214 L(--) 003* (Existing first floor plan), 2214 L(--) 004* (Existing front and rear elevations), 2214 L(--) 005* (Existing side elevation), 2214 L(--) 006* (Existing Section AA).
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interests of proper planning.
| All external materials to be used in the development shall match the appearance of those of the existing building, unless otherwise stated in the submitted application form or approved drawings.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D3 and D4 of the London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021).

| The hereby approved ^IN; rooflights to the roof slope of the hereby approved development shall not project more than 150mm from the plane of the roof slope when measured perpendicularly and shall be retained as such for the lifetime of the development.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, and to safeguard the character and appearance of the  area in accordance with policies D3 and D4 of the London Plan (2021) and policies 7B and 7.4 of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013).
